name: Le Jardin #3
description:
Paris, 2016  

Mythologically and religiously, the garden was considered as an imaginary space, a favourable environment to meditation, to confrontation between the mortal human and the eternal nature. Nowadays, the garden is a location where people go to reconnect with their higher self, to eat lunch or to sleep... In my opinion, a connection exists between these two concepts of the garden. In this series, I aimed to illustrate this idea by documenting in black and white the different conditions of people that occupy the gardens of Paris.
